fields.description:
I'm trying to write a javascript based git client that lives inside a browser extension. If I use a user agent that starts with "git", my client works. If it doesn't start with "git", bitbucket returns a 404 for git http endpoints.

The problem is that I can't set the user-agent of an xhr in production. I'm able to do it in development by intercepting the request with a local proxy and changing it before I send.
fields.summary: git over https implementation depends on the user agent starting with "git"

fields.description:
User events related to private repositories are not showing up even with an authenticated request.

I was expecting to get all events that I see in my newsfeed (on Bitbucket) from the {{{users/[username]/events}}} endpoint.
fields.summary: User events related to private repos not showing up

fields.description:
During repo creation slug is generated in lowercase. Right now using mixed case version results in 404. The suggestion is to redirect those urls.

For example

bitbucket.org/user/RepoName

redirects to

bitbucket.org/user/reponame
fields.summary: Redirect urls with mixed case repo slug to lowercase version

It would be interesting to see visitor statistics, how many clones that were made etc. I did a quick search on how to do this, I saw mentioned on StackOverflow that there was an API to get this sort of data but not how to do it.

Can I get it from BitBucket somehow, programatically or through the www site?

Cheers\\
Kjell

fields.description:
On a particular day, on a project with multiple commits on that day by the same user, there appears to be no order to the displayed commits in the news feed on the user dashboard.

They are not in chronological order, nor alphabetical or any other discernible order.

The news feed would make more sense if there was some order to the displayed commits. Chronological ordering seems most sensible.

What I did:

* One user makes multiple small commits to a single project and multiple pushes to bitbucket over the course of a couple of hours.
* Look at the news feed the following day - the commits are all there but in a random order.
fields.summary: Random order of commits in news feed (BB-3432)

fields.description:
Not sure if this is a bug or even the right component but some times when push i get "File attributes modified." when I browse the code in the commits, this didn't happen before the update and i would really appreciate it if this is fixed.\\
What does "File attributes modified." even mean anyway.\\
Thank you.\\
Givo.
fields.summary: File attributes modified

fields.description:
It would be handy to be able to search just one's local repositories, limiting the search to just metadata or including repository contents as well.

For folks with a lot of repositories, autocompleting in the search field using the repository name would be a nice, quick way to find a repo. Otherwise, if you can only remember a fragment of the repo name you can't type it directly into the URL to jump directly to the project you'd like to work with.
fields.summary: Local search of repository metadata and contents

fields.description: Since projects so often have components in multiple programming languages, it would be nice if one could tag a repository with a list of languages instead of just one.
fields.summary: Support multiple programming languages associated with repository (BB-3271)

fields.description:
Is there a way to alias a user to a computer for all projects?

We have many repositories and have SSH keys set up on our computers, but instead the username showing up from the person who commits from that computer, the SSH Key shows up not referencing the actual bitbucket account that created it.  This can be solved by aliasing that key to a user in the project repository, but that means I have to do it for every project and every user working on that project.  Is it possible not to even have the keys register?  The username is set with the remote git request so why isn't just pulling from there.  You may have some reason I am not aware of but that seems more logical to me than to have to reference the user each time.  Thanks.  Keep up the good work. :)
fields.summary: User Aliasing/Commit User Not Showing Up

fields.description: I am not sure if the bug is the URL form (SSH and not HTTPS) or service (something needs to index on BitBucket and take time?) but referencing GitHub repos in the form http://github.com/doctrine/common.git works.

fields.description:
After the side-by-side diff feature was rolled out, some of my diffs are not showing up correctly. This is not happening on all of our repositories and we cannot see any pattern as to why some of them are correct and some are not.

This occurs when looking under the commits tab and clicking on one of the revisions. On some of the repos, I only get a "File attributes modified." statement for a file even though it is only a text file and is easily diffable. These same files showed a proper context-diff before the new side-by-side style was rolled out.

See the attached screenshot. It was created in a private repository here:

https://bitbucket.org/CPCSSN/source-code-templates-guidelines/changeset/d9aabfd75e58
fields.summary: Diffs not showing properly when viewing a changeset. (BB-3272)

fields.description:
Currently, during a pull-request it is not possible to change the destination branch to be a different branch than the issuer specified.

It is possible to create a new branch on pull with the same name as the source branch, but this must be done on the issuer side.  If the issuer is proposing a merge into master, I don't necessarily want the code to be merged into master without running my own test suites.

The request can be rejected and then asked to change the destination branch, but this is clunky.  I could pull directly from their repository, into my local copy before pushing to my online repository but this makes it more difficult to perform larger peer reviews --> telling everyone to pull from that branch instead of just pulling the latest copy from the blessed repository is not intuitive.  I also cannot do this if their fork is private.

I propose the owner of the destination repository should be able to change the destination branch before pulling into his repository from the pull-request UI.

This is how I work locally when interacting with colleagues in my office, so being able to work like this from Bitbucket would be very convenient.
fields.summary: Allow pull request receiver to change destination branch

fields.description: Hello, I really like the wiki markup. I have noticed that the formatting in the comment preview is different than it appears once posted. Just a small annoyance.
fields.summary: comment preview is inconsistent

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I'm afraid we broke something on your end... Changeset d8fa35c28335 in Mercurial added extra quoting to the arguments used with SSH connections. This breaks things like hg-ssh and your conq service.

When using SSH with Bitbucket I now get\\
{{{\\
% hg incoming ssh://bb/mg/hg-i18n --debug\\
running ssh bb ''''hg''' -R '''mg/hg-i18n''' serve --stdio'\\
sending hello command\\
sending between command\\
remote: conq: invalid command syntax.\\
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!\\
}}}

For comparison, the first line was\\
{{{\\
running ssh bb "hg -R mg/hg-i18n serve --stdio"\\
}}}\\
before the change.

We're also tracking this in the Mercurial bugtracker: http://mercurial.selenic.com/bts/issue2983

I'm just putting it here too so that people can find it and so that you can figure out if you want to change the conq service before we figure out what we want to do on the Mercurial side.
fields.summary: Getting "remote: conq: invalid command syntax." when using SSH with development version of mercurial (BB-3264)

fields.description:
We would love to see bitbucket integrating with an (internal) Crowd installation. At my current client we already have a LOT of users and groups that we manage in crowd. Moving to bitbucket forces us to do the user management in two tools which is a no go for us.

HTH
fields.summary: Crowd integration for user/group management (BB-9433)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
Followed a link from http://mercurial.selenic.com/downloads/ (labeled "TortoiseHg 2.2.1 with Mercurial 2.0.1 - x64 Windows"); this site doesn't have the file referred to. Don't know if that needs fixing here or from their end.
fields.summary: Missing file at https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/downloads/tortoisehg-2.2.1-hg-2.0.1-x64.msi

fields.description:
Currently: 'conq: repository access denied.' occurs when a public key is invalid for this repo but valid for another account when loaded before the public key desired.  This is very painful for users managing multiple projects.

This happens because authentication succeeds 'debug1: Authentication succeeded (publickey).' means that ssh will accept whatever key is there blindly and passes off complete responsibility for authorization to conq.  This, unfortunately, leads to fucking the customer.

This setup subtly prevents ssh from retrying normally because authentication has already succeeded.

The most effective solution would be to modify OpenSSH (very carefully, within the realm of possibility) to check for a specific exit value to indicated authorization failure from the restricted environment (shell replacement).  This averts heavy, high-maintenance customization of OpenSSH when the existing 'conq' script has already been proven to implement the specific authorization necessary.  Simply return the authorization failure exit code in conq for 'repository access denied, and OpenSSH would then retry the next method/key available.

Proposed /etc/ssh/sshd_config: \\\
ScriptedAuthorization yes \\\
ScriptedAuthorizationFailsOnExitCode 120 # The restricted environment (shell replacement) must return this value (i.e., 120) to signify authorization failure, auth will be retried with the next available key/method.
fields.summary: Increase security and usability with numerous accounts

fields.description:

fields.summary: Downloads list should be sensibly sorted (BB-3183)

fields.description:
The use case is pretty simple: pushing code to a bitbucket repo on a remote system without exposing an encrypted private key, stored locally (usually a laptop), loaded via ssh agent.  Well aware of another ssh agent issue, this has been tested and is not related.

This works with bitbucket with a small number of keys, but it is inadequate for enterprise environments where there are likely more than 6 keys.

\* This can be increased by a simple packaged rebuild of ssh bumping AUTH_FAIL_MAX to a reasonable number (i.e., 12).  There is a theoretical reduction of complexity for attacking SSH, but it's assumed there are standard measures in place to detect and block malicious bots hammering the service (meta: practicality vs. unusable security tradeoff).

Also required:\\
/etc/ssh/sshd_config: \\\
MaxAuthTries 12 # with modified AUTH_FAIL_MAX
fields.summary: Try more than the default # of keys (6) for method publickey.

fields.description:
This if feedback regarding your signup process and your issues process, pretty much every sensitive form you have...

Checking referrer fields is not CSRF mitigation, In fact I am surprised you haven't had more complaints about it.

Also your error page is big and ugly, and discloses details on how to ex-filtrate more information from your system, indicating the use of "DEBUG=True".

I had to switch from FF 8.0 because I couldn't submit any forms on my main browser...
fields.summary: I have a bone to pick with you about CSRF.

fields.description:
I'm getting this message when viewing changeset:

bq. Not displaying diff, as it's too big.


Hmm? What is your condition for checking "it's too big"? This changeset has changed both binary (picture) and plain-text files. For plain-text changes, it has less than 50 lines changed in total.

So, does it related to change in binary file (such as jpg picture)? If yes, binary files should be treated with "no diff required". See http://cgit.freedesktop.org/libreoffice/core/commit/?id=10f977981d2cfb6ba0ccd0185ccb12e212010bc2 as an example.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please show diff, not regarding whether it's how big

fields.description:
All clone, sync and update features fail with the message "SSL: Server certificate verify failed"

We use a wildcard SSL certificate. The CN on the certificate begins with an * (asterisk). As in; *.some-domain.tld. We are using mercurial-2.0.win32-py2.6.exe on the server. I've tried setting the ServerAlias in Apache to the CN name and it doesn't help. I've verified that up-to-date cacert.pem is configured. The only solution is to manually configure .hg/hgrc with [hostfingerprints] rule where the hostname is matched by the SHA-1 fingerprint of our SSL certificate.

This is most cumbersome. Please help. Thank you.
fields.summary: Wildcard SSL certificates fail authentication in TortoiseHG 2.2

When i´ve tried to confirm my email it says it has expired, so im unable to confirm.

Couldn´t find where to click to resend the confirmation email. Could you guys send me another one?

Best regards
fields.summary: Confirmation of the email expired

fields.description:
I have a git repository and have rewritten its history and my dashboard shows (excerpt):

committed to ...\\
... - ...\\
stripped ... from ...\\
Run hg strip ... on your local copy.\\
1 minute ago

The thing is "hg strip ...." has nonsense.
fields.summary: System confuses mercurial and git (BB-3134)

fields.description:
I have set up Google Analytics for my repositories, but the problem is:

Not many people know about my repositories (yet...), so >90% of the traffic is generated by myself when I browse my repositories on Bitbucket.

I found out that Google Analytics has built-in ways to exclude my own traffic:

http://www.google.com/support/analytics/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=55481

There are two ways to do this, both described in the link above:

# exclude a range of IP adresses
# create a cookie on each of my computers to exclude all traffic from that computer

I would like to use the second possibility, but this requires me to create a page on "my" domain and visit it once from each of my computers.

Which I can't do (of course), because the way I understand it, the page needs to be somewhere under https://bitbucket.org/my_user/my_repository.

Is it possible to automatically create this for Google Analytics-enabled repositories?
fields.summary: improve Google Analytics integration: support excluding my own traffic (BB-3132)

fields.description: Hi, this is not bug, butit would be just fine if you have versions for other languages. I myself am from Russia, and I really like your widgets. but not always clear what the weather outside. I would be very glad to see the Russian version of this widget. Thanks in advance. Tim
fields.summary: HUD Weather

fields.description:
All,\\
I cannot find any ways of adding a photo to my bitbucket project. I googled a lot and people are more asking about things after uploading the image
fields.summary: change profile picture

fields.description: Would it be possible to add inline commenting on the diff in a pull request?
fields.summary: Pull Request Inline Diff Comments

fields.description:
In the activity dashboard when someone comments on a commit ( I think this was added in the August Changelog) replies to the comment do not show up.

The commit/code comments are a great addition but it is really important to have some notification that there is a conversation going on there.

Please implement this.
fields.summary: Only the first comment on a commit appears in feeds (BB-3128)

fields.description:
I tried several times adding files to the download section. I'm just unable to.

Once I select the file and click the button, the request gets transferred to amazonaws. But it returns an error.

The URL I land at after the error is:

http://hg.sterex.in/base/downloads/add?bucket=bbuseruploads&key=sterexin%2Fbase%2Fdownloads%2Fmodel.pdf&etag=%22a3280caca9c1dbb1732a0ee7ac03fb16%22

To note:\\
I use a custom domain. Should that matter?\\
I have attached a screenshot (of the kicked-over bucket!)
fields.summary: Unable to add any files to download. (BB-3122)

fields.description: After clicking "edit XX mins left" is says "Loading..." and thats it
fields.summary: Using a custom domain breaks editing issue-comments (BB-3141)

fields.description:
I want to link my StackOverflow careers page with my bitbucket account, but I'm unwilling to grant them read and write access to my private and public repos to do so.

Github offers an OAuth privilege that grants SO read-only access to my public information. So should bitbucket.
fields.summary: OAuth privileges too broad (BB-3117)

fields.description:
Bitbucket supports downloading source code over SSL, but not for the static repos at username.bitbucket.org. It would be nice if these could be served over SSL as well.

Specifically, my use case is that if an HTTPS page tries to load my markdown.css file, Chrome will present a security warning and a red "Insecure" lock icon.
fields.summary: Serve static dirs over SSL (BB-3129)

fields.description:
It would be a huge help if we could set the default filter for the commits page when you click on the tab in the admin.

We work with hgflow and seeing all the closed branches\\
This way we could set it so it hides closed branched by default
fields.summary: Allow setting of default changeset filter (BB-3121)

fields.description:
Please note that when an authenticated request is made, the *followers_count* is missing from the repositories, yet  the documentation says

//"If you make an authenticated request, you will be able to see more information about the user."//
fields.summary: /users/:username endpoint does not expose `followers_count` (BB-3123)
Wiki TOC tags create too many bullet points

fields.description:
http://groups.google.com/group/bitbucket-users/t/a41d867c4931fae2 has no informative answer why bitbucket users can't use ssh or ftp in order to upload files to "Downloads" page of their repo.\\
It can be useful for big files and automated build/test systems (thx, Tom!).
fields.summary: File uploads for 'Add download'

fields.description: Assuming a case where my milestone is 1.0.0 and let's say I have some 1.0.0-BETA and RC planned to reach my milestone or some internal releases. Right not the "version" attribute is not clear if it refers to the version where the bug is found or the version where the bug is closed (or am I misusing the version and milestone properties?). I think a "Close version" property would help clearly stating what version is affected by a bug (version property) and where it has been fixed (close version). It would be also easy to provide a changelog to the users simply querying by "Close version". As fas as I remember also JIRA has this approach.
fields.summary: Add a "Close version" property (BB-3124)

fields.description:
Butbucket started using "/" as a hotkey for search box on the top of the page. This setting collides with the default "in-page" search available in various browsers.

Since the functionality is completely different: "/" in browsers searches on the current page, in bitbucket it searches the whole service, I'd like to see the default left alone. It looks like a regression to me. Can we get the search hotkey back?
fields.summary: Search shortcut collides with firefox's default
